org.smpp.pdu

Class ShortMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.SmppObject
      • org.smpp.pdu.ByteData
        • org.smpp.pdu.ShortMessage

  • public class ShortMessage
extends ByteData
    Provides encapsulation of message data with optional message encoding. Can contain an ordinary data message or a message containing data encoded in one of the Java supported encodings, including multibyte. On Java encodings see Supported encodings
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.4 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.smpp.SmppObject

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShortMessage(int maxLength)
      Construct the short message with max data length -- the max count of octets carried by the massege.
      ShortMessage(int minLength, int maxLength)
      Construct the short message with mina nd max data length -- the min and max count of octets carried by the massege.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShortMessage

        public ShortMessage(int maxLength)
        Construct the short message with max data length -- the max count of octets carried by the massege. It's not count of chars when interpreted with certain encoding.
        Parameters:
        maxLength - the max length of the message

      • ShortMessage

        public ShortMessage(int minLength,
                    int maxLength)
        Construct the short message with mina nd max data length -- the min and max count of octets carried by the massege. It's not count of chars when interpreted with certain encoding.
        Parameters:
        minLength - the min length of the message
        maxLength - the max length of the message

    • Method Detail

      • setData

        public void setData(ByteBuffer buffer)
             throws PDUException,
                    NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException,
                    TerminatingZeroNotFoundException
        Reads data from the buffer and stores them into messageData. The data can be later fetched using one of the getMessage methods.
        Specified by:
        setData in class ByteData
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer containing the message data; must contain exactly the data of the message (not zero terminated nor length tagged)
        Throws:
        PDUException - some data in the buffer were invalid
        NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException - expected more data in the buffer
        TerminatingZeroNotFoundException - the c-string in buffer wasn't terminated with 0 zero
        See Also:
        getMessage(), getMessage(String)

      • isSourceAddressDIGEVO

        public boolean isSourceAddressDIGEVO(String address)

      • setData

        public void setData(ByteBuffer buffer,
                    String address,
                    Byte dataCoding)
             throws PDUException,
                    NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException,
                    TerminatingZeroNotFoundException
        Throws:
        PDUException
        NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException
        TerminatingZeroNotFoundException

      • getData

        public ByteBuffer getData()
        Returns the sequence of octets generated from the message according the encoding provided.
        Specified by:
        getData in class ByteData
        Returns:
        the bytes generated from the message
        See Also:
        ByteData.setData(ByteBuffer), TLV, ValueNotSetException

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(String message)
                throws WrongLengthOfStringException
        Sets the message a new value. Default encoding Data.ENC_GSM7BIT is used.
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        Throws:
        WrongLengthOfStringException - thrown when the message too short or long

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(String message,
                       String encoding)
                throws WrongLengthOfStringException,
                       UnsupportedEncodingException
        Sets the message to a value with given encoding.
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        encoding - the encoding of the message provided
        Throws:
        WrongLengthOfStringException - thrown when the message too short or long
        UnsupportedEncodingException - if the required encoding is not available for the Java Runtime system

      • setEncoding

        public void setEncoding(String encoding)
                 throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Sets the encoding of the messasge. Handy for message read from ByteBuffer to set the encoding ad hoc.
        Parameters:
        encoding - the message encoding
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException - if the required encoding is not available for the Java Runtime system

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(String address)
        Returns the message. If the message was read from ByteBuffer and no explicit encoding is set, the Data.ENC_GSM7BIT encoding is used. Otherwise the encoding set is used.

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage()

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(String encoding,
                         String address)
                  throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Returns the message applying the provided encoding to convert the sequence of octets.
        Parameters:
        encoding - the required encoding of the resulting (String) message
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException - if the required encoding is not available for the Java Runtime system

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns the length of the message in octets.

      • getEncoding

        public String getEncoding()
        Returns the encoding of the message.

      • encodingSupported

        public static boolean encodingSupported(String encoding)
        Returns if the encoding provided is supported by the Java Runtime system.

      • debugString

        public String debugString()
        Description copied from class: ByteData
        Returns human readable version of the data carried by the object. Derived classes should override this method with possible inclusion of result of super.debugString().
        Overrides:
        debugString in class ByteData
        Returns:
        the textual form of the content of the object
